newsitem.title: USA: Netscape, Concentric offer office services.
newsitem.headline: Netscape, Concentric offer office services.

text.p: Netscape Communications Corp. said it and privately held Concentric Network Corp. have formed a partnership to offer customers office services over the Internet.
The services enable individuals and small businesses to use an Internet connection to establish a "virtual office" accessible through Netscape's Internet site.

Netscape Virtual Office by Concentric will include e-mail accounts, private discussion groups and project collaboration, without the expense of extensive hardware, software and technical personnel, the companies said.
Users need Internet access and Netscape software to access the services, along with a credit card for billing purposes, the companies said.
Concentric, based in Cupertino, Calif., supplies computer network services.
Netscape stock added 75 cents to $36.50 on Nasdaq.
